text: so my name is kasha brits and i'm a
population geneticist at 23andme
my background actually is in statistics
and math and i use that background to
work in problems in population genetics
i think it's fascinating that we can
look at genetic variation and learn
about how we evolved and how we got here
and why we are the way we are one of the
projects i'm working on is trying to
understand
how
different populations in the u.s are
genetically similar and different
so i'm looking at
african americans and latinos and
european americans and trying to
understand their genetic ancestry
and i think it'll help us understand
just the amount of genetic viability
that's in the u.s
as we continue going forward i think
it's just phenomenal how much
new potential discoveries we can make
how many potential discoveries there are
with the genetic data as it comes out so
you can keep going and asking more
complex questions and more nuanced
questions and really dig into
understanding how
genes and traits and ancestry all
intertwine and make us all human
you
